column4: hello, i'm having trouble with alsa and my mic. i believe the computer cries at the fact that i have hdmi output too, so it appears as if i had two cards. any ideas about what could be going on?
i think you can run gnome-alsaconfig and disable the other one
there are ways to disable hdmi i just don't remember how... have to mess with some /etc files google disabling hdmi 12.04 or something like that
but the thing is this, i dont' know if this is the problem. do you have an intuition that it is?
i know i've had problems with that before too, but i'm not certain either
but if you don't use hdmi you can disable it to make sure
in dealing with these problems if you don't have any log errors or errors to help you along the way the only real thing you can do is try things to get more info
if you disable hdmi and it works great, if not at least you know it's not that
your monitor doesn' have a builtin mic does it?
ah, what makes you think it's hdmi then, do you have something plugged into hdmi?
well, it doesn't show anything... and i have hdmi sound whenever i connect the hdmi port...
ah it was gnome-alsamixer if you want to disable hdmi (i think it will let you disable)
are you running debian or ubuntu?
